comments.body: Good catch, could you fix golint error in this package with this change?

Thanks! At the beginning, I thought this was a small modification, so I submitted it together.
However, if I fix golint error for the whole package, I think it is beyond the scope of this PR :(
Would you mind if I send a PR separately to fix golint error?

nit: can you group the new ones and the old ones together and add an explicit TODO to remove the old once once we fully migrate to the new api
I mean sth like:
```
EventClient ...
Record ...
Broadcaster ...

// TODO: Remove the following after fully migrating to the new events api.
CoreEventClient ...
LeaderElectionBoadcaster ...
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +52,56 @@	// TODO: Remove the following after fully migrating to the new events api.
	CoreEventClient           v1core.EventsGetter
	LeaderElectionBroadcaster record.EventBroadcaster

	Recorder    events.EventRecorder

comments.body: @aveshagarwal @kubernetes/sig-scheduling-feature-requests we need to figure out what is local to the machine the scheduler is running on and what is shared configuration and placed in etcd.  It's not obvious to me where that line is drawn and some things seem unusual.  For instance, there is a file reference for a kubeconfigfile that refers to something on disk.  1. the kubeconfig is needed in order to contact the apiserver to find the configmap config, and 2. I don't think I would expect the disk layout across all schedulers to be consistent.

Continuing that thought, I wouldn't expect the bind addresses to be shared either.

I think I would that I want configuration options controlling behavior to be shared amongst all scheduler instances and I want configuration options controlling exposure and connections to be specific to a particular scheduler instance.

This pull has the misfortune of exposing these problems.

@deads2k so far there are 2 things the scheduler is referring on disk: 1)  https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/componentconfig/types.go#L47 which is one of options among on-disk file, configmap and algorithmprovider 2) path to kubeconfig:  https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/componentconfig/types.go#L26 

> I don't think I would expect the disk layout across all schedulers to be consistent.

makes sense.

> I think I would that I want configuration options controlling behavior to be shared amongst all scheduler instances and I want configuration options controlling exposure and connections to be specific to a particular scheduler instance.

So that means these options kubeconfigfile path, bindaddresses (health, metrics), QPS, Burst  per instance, and i think all other options can be shared.
